intro: Xanthostemon retusus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandblow, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland areas. Xanthostemon retusus is adapted to withstand dry conditions and is sometimes used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
